criteria: Accuracy in identifying lines of symmetry
Ability to draw lines of symmetry
descriptions: No attempt to identify lines of symmetry or demonstrates complete misunderstanding.
Identifies lines of symmetry with significant inaccuracies or only in very simple figures.
Identifies lines of symmetry in some figures, but makes frequent errors or omissions.
Generally identifies lines of symmetry correctly in most figures, with occasional minor errors.
Accurately identifies lines of symmetry in a variety of two-dimensional figures with few errors.
Consistently and accurately identifies all lines of symmetry in complex two-dimensional figures, demonstrating a thorough understanding.
Unable to draw lines of symmetry or demonstrates a complete misunderstanding of the concept.
Attempts to draw lines of symmetry, but the lines are inaccurate or misplaced.
Draws lines of symmetry with some accuracy, but may have difficulty with more complex figures.
Generally draws lines of symmetry correctly, with occasional minor errors in placement or orientation.
Accurately draws lines of symmetry in a variety of figures, demonstrating good understanding.
Consistently and accurately draws lines of symmetry in complex figures, demonstrating precision and a deep understanding of symmetry.
Demonstrates no understanding of line-symmetric figures.
Demonstrates limited understanding of line-symmetric figures; struggles to differentiate between symmetric and non-symmetric figures.
Identifies some line-symmetric figures, but shows inconsistencies or misunderstandings.
Generally understands line-symmetric figures and can identify them correctly in most cases.
Clearly understands line-symmetric figures and can accurately identify them and explain their properties.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of line-symmetric figures, including the ability to explain their properties and identify them in novel or complex situations.
